main event: An unidentified circular orange object was sighted at Wurtsmith AFB, Michigan, on 7 January 1956, with radar lock-on for approximately two minutes before it disappeared.
interesting points: The object was initially described as circular and orange,The control tower's radar tracked the object at an overtake speed of fifty knots before it vanished from the radar,Noteworthy conclusions suggested the object might be a balloon or aircraft, although this remains uncertain,The object was observed for a total of about 15 minutes by multiple individuals including radar operators and pilots,There were two separate sightings involving circular and spherical shapes, but both concluded potential balloon characteristics.
witness description: Air Force personnel including pilots and control tower operators
